required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-Term Follow-Up Study of Patients Receiving ATL001
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Multi-Centre Phase II Study Evaluating the Long-Term Safety and Clinical Activity of Neoantigen Reactive T Cells in Patients Who Have Previously Received ATL001 in a Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This is an Open-Label, Multi-Centre Phase II study to evaluate the long-term safety and clinical activity of ATL001, previously administered intravenously to patients in Study ATX-NS-001 (NCT04032847) or Study ATX-ME-001 (NCT03997474).

detailed_description.textblock:
Up to 90 patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer ( NSCLC) or melanoma will be enrolled after either: completing 2 years of follow-up visits in study ATX-NS-001 or study ATX-ME-001; or voluntary withdrawal from these studies prior to the completion of the 2 year of follow-up period.
Each patient will be followed up for a minimum period of 5 years, or until death if sooner, in this Long-Term Follow Up Protocol.
For patients who are still alive after 5 years of follow-up, survival data will continue to be collected until the end of the study, which will occur when the last patient has completed 5 years of follow-up withdraws from study or has died.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of adverse events to evaluate Safety and Tolerability of ATL001
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 4 months to 60 months; then every 6 months until death or until the end of the study, whichever came first, assessed up to 84 months.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the frequency and severity of adverse events related to ATL001

primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 4 months to 60 months; then every 6 months until death or until the end of the study, whichever came first, assessed up to 84 months.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the frequency and severity of autoimmune adverse events

primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 4 months to 60 months; then every 6 months until death or until the end of the study, whichever came first, assessed up to 84 months.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the frequency and severity of new malignancies

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Assessment for Duration of Response ( DoR)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the endpoint of duration of response, as assessed by investigator and Independent Central Review (ICR) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors ( RECIST) version1.1

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Assessment for Progression Free Survival
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the efficacy endpoint of progression-free survival ( PFS) as assessed by the investigator and ICR per RECIST v1.1

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Assessment for Time to first subsequent anti-cancer therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the long-term requirement for anti-cancer therapy after ATL001 therapy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months until death or until the end of the study, whichever came first, assessed up to 84 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate overall survival ( OS) by investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Assessment for Cancer-related medical resources
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the long-term requirement for cancer-related medical resources following ATL001 therapy

clinical_study.condition: Advanced Non Small Cell Lung Cancer

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients who have previously received ATL001 in study ATX-NS-001 or study ATX-ME-001

intervention.intervention_name: Long-Term Follow-Up of Patients who Received ATL001
intervention.description: Patients who received ATL001 in a clinical trial will be evaluated in this trial for long-term efficacy and safety.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients who have previously received ATL001 in study ATX-NS-001 or study ATX-ME-001

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients must have given written informed consent to participate in the study.
2. Patients must have received ATL001 in previous Clinical Trial ATX-NS-001 or ATX-ME-001.
3. Patients must be considered, in the opinion of the Investigator, capable of complying with the protocol requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
There are no exclusion criteria.
